supporting_spans: The quartermaster made his preparations for departure, aided by the two sailors, one of whom attended to his horse, and the other to his provisions.
Ayrton suddenly sprang to his feet. In his hand was a revolver. A report was heard; and Glenarvan fell, struck by a bullet.
contradicting_spans: The quartermaster made his preparations for departure, aided by the two sailors, one of whom attended to his horse, and the other to his provisions. Meantime Glenarvan wrote the letter designed for Tom Austin.
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The evidence contradicts the claim that Tom Ayrton was born near Exeter to a fisherman father and a mother who died young.

analysis.claim_text: Tom Ayrton was born near Exeter to a fisherman father, retired naval petty-officer James Ayrton; his mother died young and he was reared by his elder brother Benjamin, learning tides and wind signs on fishing trips while secretly studying the Nautical Almanac and dreaming of “conquering the seas.”

sub_claims.text: Tom Ayrton was born near Exeter to a fisherman father, retired naval petty-officer James Ayrton; his mother died young and he was reared by his elder brother Benjamin.
Tom Ayrton learned tides and wind signs on fishing trips while secretly studying the Nautical Almanac and dreaming of ‘conquering the seas.’

analysis.reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The evidence contradicts the claim that Tom Ayrton was born near Exeter to a fisherman father and a mother who died young.
